titleStmt.title: J. F. McClain et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4280

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Octr 2d/ 63
To his Excellency
Thos E Bramlett
Governor of Ky
Respected Sir --

The undersigned, will Respectfully state to your Excellency that they are the Jury that tried James McCawley & Wesley Garrett for Keeping a gaming house in the Town of Blandville, We further State that the evidence was barely sufficient to warrant us in finding a verdict against them, We therefore, think from all the circumstances connected with the case, that it is one that deserves Executive Interposition.

Very Respectfully
your obedient Servants &c
J. F. McClain
J M Owen
W. G. Scott
Joseph Kimmel
W. L. Skinner
A. Hook
J. W. Rudolph
J. L. Brown, Jr
B. F. Fraser
